thread.title: ‘Once’ again bares the soul of a Dublin busker, this time on stage
thread.title_full: ‘Once’ again bares the soul of a Dublin busker, this time on stage - The Washington Post

author: By Nelson Pressley
title: ‘Once’ again bares the soul of a Dublin busker, this time on stage
text:
Stuart Ward as Guy and Dani de Waal as Girl in “Once,” the musical adapted from a 2007 movie about a Dublin busker and the woman with whom he strikes up a collaboration. (Joan Marcus/Joan Marcus) By Nelson Pressley Theater critic July 9 at 10:00 PM Follow @nelsonpressley In the half-hour before the musical “Once” begins, you can hit the cash bar on the Kennedy Center’s Eisenhower Theater stage and hang out with musicians serving up foot-stomping songs. The performers in this 2012 Tony-winning Broadway show play guitars, mandolins and fiddles on the Dublin pub set. They romp around and sing up a storm. It’s a party.
There is more high-spirited energy in this pre-show fun than in the entire understated 85-minute movie that inspired this unlikely stage hit. The 2007 film was a quiet treasure about a lovelorn Irish street musician (known as Guy) and an immigrant Czech woman (called Girl) who strike up a friendship.
